content: In the first half of 2022, the company's revenue from continuing operation increased by 20.9% to RMB 211.4 million, net income increased to RMB 42.7 million and adjusted net income increased by 282.1 to RMB42.7 million as well. For the first half of 2022, we saw a decrease of 36.6% or RMB 20.6 million in G&A expense. The total revenue were RMB 211.4 million, an increase of 20.9% from RMB 174.8 million in the first half of 2021. Revenue from customers was RMB 180.2 million, an increase of 7.7% from RMB 167.4 million in the first half of 2021. Revenues from government cooperative agreements were RMB31.2 million, an increase of 318.9% from RMB 7.5 million in the first half of 2021. Cost of revenues were RMB121.5 million, an increase of 13.5% from RMB 107.0 million in the first half of 2021. Gross profit was RMB 90.0 million, an increase of 32.6% from RMB 67.9 million in the first half of 2021. Net operating expense were RMB 36.1 million, a decrease of 35.3% from RMB 55.9 million in the first half of 2021. Selling and marketing expense were RMB 2.5 million, a decrease of 3% from RMB 2.5 million in the first half of 2021. General and administrative expenses were RMB 35.7 million, a decrease of 36.6% from RMB 56.3 million in the first half of 2021. Government grants were RMB 2.1 million, a decrease of 30.6% from RMB 3 million in the first half of 2021. Income from operations was RMB 53.8 million, an increase of 348.6% from RMB 12 million in the first half of 2021. Net income for continuing operations was RMB 49.9 million, an increase of 1,102% from RMB 4.2 million in the first half of 2021. Net loss from discontinued operation was RMB 7.2 million, decrease of 8.9% of RMB 7.9 million in the first half of 2021. Adjusted net income non-GAAP measure was RMB 42.7 million, an increase of 282.1% from RMB 11.2 million in the first half of 2021. For business outlook, for the entire fiscal year of 2022 the company expects a total revenue of continuing operations to be between RMB 440 million to RMB 460 million, representing an increase of 10% to 15% on a year over year basis.
